title: How to Easily Cancel With Midjourney (& Potentially Get a Refund)

steps.title: Go to https://www.midjourney.com/auth/signin/ in a web browser and sign in.
steps.content: Go to https://www.midjourney.com/auth/signin/ in a web browser and sign in. Click the yellow Sign In with Discord button underneath the animated Midjourney header. You'll sign in with your Discord credentials.

steps.title: Authorize Midjourney syncing with your Discord account.
steps.content: Authorize Midjourney syncing with your Discord account. You must allow Midjourney and Discord to connect so you can access your account settings.

steps.title: Click the Manage Sub button on the left-hand side.
steps.content: Click the Manage Sub button on the left-hand side. The option has an icon that looks like a pencil drawing on a square of paper.

steps.title: Click the Cancel Plan button on the right-hand side.
steps.content: Click the Cancel Plan button on the right-hand side. It's in the same pane as your billing and payment info.

steps.title: Click Confirm Cancellation on the pop up.
steps.content: Click Confirm Cancellation on the pop up. Once you cancel your Midjourney subscription, you'll be able to keep using the subscription until the start of your next billing cycle. [1] X Research source If you cancel and you've used less than 20 GPU minutes, you are eligible for a refund on your latest subscription payment. If you're able to get a refund, Midjourney will ask on the confirmation screen if you want to cancel at the end of your subscription period or cancel immediately to get a refund. [2] X Research source Cancelling your Midjourney subscription means you won't have access to Midjourney's tools as well as the Discord server once your subscription ends. Your images will not be deleted.
